s.text: I just say that if every black character must be passed through a prism of political correctness, that is not fair to the character, the actor, or the author.
My own feeling is that the film deserves its chance to develop in the minds of its viewers before being defined in a tidal wave of buzz.
My own feeling is that the film deserves its chance to develop in the minds of its viewers before being defined in a tidal wave of buzz.
Has race so sensitized us that no black character can appear in any movie without being analyzed as a black character?
